scoring.data_model module¶

class scoring.data_model.DataModel[source]¶

Bases: object

load_check_ios(credentials)[source]¶

Load check input-output pairs from the database. Poll inputs will be left in the following format: List(input_class_str, Dict(attr->value)).

Parameters:
  • credentials (List(Credential)) – List of credentials to associate
  • pairs with (input-output) –
Returns:

Mapping of check IDs to a list of

check input-output pairs
Return type:

Dict(int->List(CheckIO))
load_checks(check_ios)[source]¶

Load checks from the database.

Parameters:check_ios (Dict(int->List(CheckIO))) – Mapping of check IDs to a list of check input-output pairs to associate checks with
Returns:
A list of checks and the ID of their associated
services
Return type:List(Check,int)
load_credentials(teams, domains)[source]¶

Load credentials from the database.

Parameters:
  • teams (Dict(int->Team)) – Mapping of team database IDs to Teams to associate credentials with
  • domains (List(Domain)) – List of domains to associate credentials with
Returns:

List of credentials
Return type:

List(Credential)
load_db()[source]¶

Load all data from the database.

load_domains()[source]¶

Load domains from the database.

Returns:List of domains
Return type:List(Domain)
load_results()[source]¶

Update self.results with any results not yet loaded from the database.

load_services(checks)[source]¶

Load services from the database.

Parameters:checks (List(Check,int)) – List of pairs of service IDs and the check to associate a service with
Returns:A list of services
Return type:List(Service)
load_settings()[source]¶

Load global settings from the database.

load_teams()[source]¶

Load teams from the database.

Returns:A mapping of team database IDs to Teams
Return type:Dict(int->Team)
reload_credentials()[source]¶

Reload the credentials from the database, modifying the Credential objects already in use.

reset_db()[source]¶

Delete all data from the database.

scoring.db module¶

scoring.db.connect()[source]¶

Connect to the MySQL database with the globally defined credentials and host.

Returns:A connection to the database
Return type:(Connection)
scoring.db.execute(cmd, args=None)[source]¶

Execute a MySQL command on the database.

Parameters:
  • cmd (str) – MySQL command to execute
  • args (Tuple(str)) – Optional, arguments for a prepared statement
Returns:

The ID of the last row created or modified by the command
Return type:

(int)
scoring.db.get(table, columns, where=None, orderby=None, args=None)[source]¶

Execute a SELECT statement on the database and return the matching columns.

Parameters:
  • table (str) – Table to SELECT data from
  • columns (str) – Columns to get
  • where (str) – Optional, MySQL WHERE statement
  • orderby (str) – Optional, MySQL ORDER BY statement
  • args (Tuple(str)) – Optional, arguments for a prepared statement
Returns:

List of rows which match the SELECT statement
Return type:

(List(List(object)))
scoring.db.getall(table)[source]¶

Get all rows from the given table.

Parameters:table (str) – The table to get rows from
Returns:List of all rows in the table
Return type:(List(List(object)))
scoring.db.insert(table, columns, args)[source]¶

Insert data into the given table.

Parameters:
  • table (str) – The table to insert data into
  • columns (List(str)) – List of columns identifying the data
  • args (List(str)) – List of pieces of data corresponding to the columns
Returns:

The ID of the row
Return type:

(int)
scoring.db.modify(table, set, args, where=None)[source]¶
scoring.db.reset_all_tables()[source]¶

Delete all data from all tables in the database.

scoring.db.reset_table(table)[source]¶

Delete all rows from the given table.

Parameters:table (str) – Table to delete all data from
scoring.db.set_credential_password(username, password, team_id, service_id=None, domain_id=None)[source]¶

Set the password for the credentials matching the given criteria.

Parameters:
  • username (str) – The username of the credentials
  • password (str) – The password to change to
  • team_id (str) – The ID of the team of the credentials
  • service_id (str) – Optional, the ID of the service of the credentials. service_id and domain_id cannot both be None
  • domain_id (str) – Optional, the ID of the domain of the credentials. service_id and domain_id cannot both be None

scoring.db_writer module¶

scoring.db_writer.write_check_ios(check_ios, poll_inputs, check_ids)[source]¶

Write the given input-output pairs to the database.

Parameters:
  • check_ios (Dict(int->CheckIO args)) – A mapping of check input-output pair config IDs to check input-output pair initializaiton arguments
  • poll_inputs (Dict(int->Serialized PollInput)) – A mapping of poll input config IDs to serialized poll inputs
  • check_ids (Dict(int->int)) – A mapping of check config IDs to check database IDs
Returns:

A mapping of check input-output pair config IDs

to check input-output pair database IDs
Return type:

Dict(int->int)

A mapping of check config IDs to

check database IDs

Dict(int->int)
